pull.title: [WIP] Segregated Witness
pull.body:
This PR should allow people to look at the current implementation.
[work in progress]

events.body: I've deleted the post by @sadshoe. Please limit the discussion here to the code only.

events.message: Keep addrman's nService bits consistent with outbound observations
Verify that outbound connections have expected services
Only store and connect to NODE_NETWORK nodes
test: Re-introduce JSON pretty printing in test builder

test: Script_error checking in script_invalid tests

Check the returned script_error. Add expected script_error
for generated as well as custom tests.

The specific error is not part of consensus, however
it could avoid unclear reporting issues such as #6862 in the future.

Fixes #7513.
Fix JSON pretty printing in script_tests

Fix some misconstructed tests

They claimed to be testing P2SH scripts with non-push scriptSigs, but
1) they were not enabling P2SH
2) they have push-only scriptSigs

Fix this, and add a few more related cases.
Fix formatting of NOPs for generated script tests
Make script_error a mandatory 4th field for script_tests
Get rid of expect in script_tests as it's implied by scripterror
Merge script_valid and script_invalid tests
[qa] wallet: Wait for reindex to catch up

Use txid as key in mapAlreadyAskedFor

Previously we used the CInv that would be sent to the peer announcing the
transaction as the key, but using the txid instead allows us to decouple the
p2p layer from the application logic (which relies on this map to avoid
duplicate tx requests).
Change mapRelay to store CTransactions
--- [SEGWIT] begin: segnet ---

Don't check the genesis block PoW

Inspired by Jorge Timon's "Testchain: Don't check the genesis block", but
restricted to just PoW check.

Code by Matt Corallo, originally submitted as a patch to segwit.
Create segnet4
Add segnet seed nodes
qt: Work (don't crash) with -segnet
--- [SEGWIT] begin: P2P/node/consensus ---

Add segregated witness transaction serialization

Contains refactorings by Eric Lombrozo.
Contains fixup by Nicolas Dorier.
Removed ppszTypeName from protocol.cpp
getdata enum issue fix

Introduce and preferentially peer with NODE_WITNESS service bit

Service bit logic by Nicolas Dorier.

Witness commitment validation

Includes a fix by Suhas Daftuar
Script validation logic for witnesses
Enable SCRIPT_VERIFY_WITNESS for mempool transactions
Activate script consensus rules through BIP9
Only download blocks from witness peers after fork
Observe input amounts: verification

Add signature version 1 with updated sighash

Includes simplifications by Eric Lombrozo.

Return witness data

Includes RPC field name changes by Luke-jr.

Implement block size/sigop cost rules, limits, and GBT support

Includes changes by Suhas Daftuar and Luke-jr.
Add command line options to loosen mempool acceptance rules

bitcoinconsensus: add method that accepts amount, and return error when verify_script receives VERIFY_WITNESS flag

script_tests: always test bitcoinconsensus_verify_script_with_amount if VERIFY_WITNESS isn't set

Rename internal method + make it static

trim bitcoinconsensus_ prefix

Add SERIALIZE_TRANSACTION_WITNESS flag

Increase MAX_PROTOCOL_MESSAGE_LENGTH

Witness blocks can be greater than 2MiB, but cannot be validly greater
than 4MB.
Add rewind logic to deal with post-fork software updates
--- [SEGWIT] begin: wallet ---
Witness script signing

Add witness address RPCs (using P2SH)

Includes support for pushkeyhash wit v0 by Alex Morcos.
signrawtransaction can sign P2WSH
--- [SEGWIT] begin: tests ---
Signing tests

Add rpc test for segwit

Amended by Pieter Wuille to use multisig 1-of-1 for P2WSH tests, and BIP9
based switchover logic.

Add transaction tests for segwit

...with the four types of segwit payment, as well as all sighash combinaisons.
Add segwit support to script_tests
Autogeneration support for witness in script_tests

Update p2p test framework with segwit support

mininode now supports witness transactions/blocks, blocktools
has a helper for adding witness commitments to blocks, and script
has a function to calculate hashes for signature under sigversion
1, used by segwit.
P2P test for segwit

comments.body: would be nice if the code has more comments that referred to documentation that explains what some of these numbers are
"some long time in the future" (as we don't have a planned activation date for segwit on mainnet yet). actual segwit will be deployed using versionbits, so this will go away
